title: Update ZIKOLN hero/about copy and increase pink accents

requirements.text: Update the site copy to reflect the user-provided ZIKOLN bio, ensuring all user-facing text is in English and removing duplicated/awkward phrasing from the provided text.

quotes:
Hello, I’
m
ZIKOLN 
GRAPHIC DESIGNER
A graphic and motion designer with over 1 years 
of experience... add these details ass well

acceptanceCriteria: Hero section includes ZIKOLN name and “Graphic Designer” title in a prominent, readable way.

About section bio text includes: (1) 1+ years of experience, (2) emphasis on creativity and attention to detail, (3) specialties: Logos & Branding, Typography, Social Media Design, Motion Graphics, and (4) mastery of Adobe Creative Suite.
No duplicated sentence remains (e.g., the repeated “I have master Design tool such as Adobe Creative ...”).
All updated copy is written in clear English.

requirements.text: Replace placeholder personal identity strings with the ZIKOLN name wherever the site currently displays a default name (e.g., configuration-driven name and footer copyright line).
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/content/siteConfig.ts` uses the name “ZIKOLN” instead of the current placeholder.
Footer displays “© [current year] ZIKOLN — Built in the Future” (year remains dynamic).
No other user-facing sections show the placeholder name (e.g., “Alex Rivera”).

requirements.text: Adjust the global visual styling to incorporate more pink accents across key UI highlights while keeping the existing futuristic neon aesthetic consistent site-wide.
acceptanceCriteria: Pink/magenta accents are more noticeable across the UI (e.g., gradients, glow/shadow accents, borders, highlights) without reducing readability/contrast.
At least one primary gradient treatment (e.g., hero headline gradient and/or major section headings) includes a stronger pink presence.
At least one core component accent (e.g., GlassPanel neon accents, buttons, or similar highlights) uses the magenta/pink option in a visible way.
Changes respect reduced-motion behavior (no new mandatory animations that ignore prefers-reduced-motion).

constraints: Do not edit files in the immutable frontend paths list (e.g., `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x)`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/ui`).
Keep backend architecture as a single Motoko actor; this request does not require backend changes.
nonGoals: Do not add new sections, new navigation, or new backend data models for this request.
Do not change authentication behavior (Internet Identity) or React Query/actor wiring.
Do not generate new images for this request unless required to support the copy/color updates.
